intro: Cryptocarya microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the Lauraceae family. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruits are small, woody drupes that contain a single seed, and it prefers moist, shaded environments in temperate forests. Cryptocarya microcarpa plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
